intro: Sprengelia brachynema, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
